title: Javascript Basics
description-brief: JavaScript is one of the most popular programming languages in the world, and growing faster than any other programming language. As a developer, you can use JavaScript to build web and mobile apps, real-time networking apps, command-line tools, and games.
requirements: No coding experience is required to take this course.
course-promises: Understand the fundamental concepts in JavaScript
Learn and apply the best practices
Avoid common pitfalls and mistakes other JavaScript developers make
course-motivations: JavaScript is a key tool for front-end, back-end, and full-stack developers.
The average annual salary for a JavaScript developer is $72,000.
Companies like Walmart, Netflix, and PayPal run big internal applications around JavaScript.
Having strong JavaScript knowledge will help you land your dream job.
course-target: Aspiring developers - perhaps you learned a little bit of HTML and CSS and want to take your first JavaScript programming course. This course is an ideal starting point.

Experienced developers with no degree in computer science - there are a lot of self-taught web developers out there who cannot solve basic programming problems, because they never attended a college. Don't be one of those! This course teaches you the fundamental programming skills that every developer must know.

Anyone who wants to better understand JavaScript - chances are you've taken another course but didn't understand certain topics well. You can take this course to fill the gaps and strengthen your understanding of JavaScript.

title: Game Theory
description-brief: Game theory is the mathematical modeling of strategic interaction among rational (and irrational) agents. Beyond what we call `games' in common language, such as chess, poker, soccer, etc., it includes the modeling of conflict among nations, political campaigns, competition among firms, and trading behavior in markets such as the NYSE.
requirements: Basic understanding of probability and algebra.
course-promises: Understand Nash equilibrium and its applications
Apply game theory concepts to real-world scenarios
course-motivations: Essential for economics, business, and political science
Used in AI development and strategic decision making

title: 3D Modeling
description-brief: Take your 3D skills to the next dimension. This advanced course is designed for experienced artists and designers who want to master the craft of 3D modeling, texturing, rigging, and real-time rendering. You’ll work on complex projects—from character design and animation cycles to environment building and lighting in game engines.
requirements: Familiarity with design software is recommended.
course-motivations: 3D modeling is a key skill in gaming and animation
High demand in industries like architecture and VFX
course-target: 3D artists looking to refine their skills
Engineers and architects needing 3D modeling skills

title: Arduino for Beginners
description-brief: Get started with Arduino and build your own electronic projects.Curious about electronics but not sure where to start? This hands-on course is perfect for beginners who want to dive into the world of Arduino and physical computing—no prior experience required.
course-promises: Learn the basics of Arduino programming
course-motivations: Arduino is widely used in robotics and IoT projects
Hands-on learning with real-world applications

title: Cloud Computing
description-brief: Learn cloud computing principles and services like AWS and Azure.
course-motivations: Cloud computing is the future of IT infrastructure
Essential skill for software engineers and IT professionals

title: Cybersecurity Essentials
description-brief: Protect systems and networks from cyber threats.
requirements: Solid understanding of IT systems is recommended.
course-motivations: Cybersecurity is a high-demand field
Essential skill for IT and security professionals

title: Digital Marketing
description-brief: Master digital marketing strategies to grow your business online.
course-motivations: Digital marketing is crucial for modern businesses
High demand for digital marketing professionals

title: Creative Writing
description-brief: Unlock your creativity and master storytelling techniques.
course-promises: Improve narrative flow and writing style
course-motivations: Learn from successful authors.
Develop a strong personal writing style.
Enhance your storytelling abilities.

title: Data Analytics
description-brief: Analyze data, build reports, and make data-driven decisions.
requirements: Basic knowledge of Excel and statistics.
course-promises: Apply statistical methods to real-world problems
course-motivations: Data analytics is one of the fastest-growing fields.
High demand for skilled analysts.
Data-driven decision-making is key to business success.

title: Front-End Development
description-brief: Master front-end development by learning modern web technologies and frameworks.
requirements: Basic understanding of the internet and web browsing.
course-promises: Use JavaScript to create interactive UI
course-motivations: Front-end development is in high demand.
Develop a strong portfolio to showcase your skills.
Work remotely or as a freelancer.

title: Machine Learning
description-brief: Dive into the world of Machine Learning and explore how algorithms learn from data.
requirements: Basic understanding of Python and statistics.
course-motivations: Machine Learning is driving AI advancements.
High demand for ML engineers.
Opportunity to work in cutting-edge technology.

title: Video Editing
description-brief: Master video editing skills using industry-standard tools and create stunning content.
course-promises: Learn to use Adobe Premiere and Final Cut Pro
course-motivations: Video editing is a valuable skill in digital media.
Enhance your creativity and storytelling.
Opportunities in filmmaking, marketing, and social media.

title: Film Theory
description-brief: Explore the history and theory behind cinema, learning how films convey meaning through visuals, sound, and narrative.
requirements: Interest in film studies; no prior experience required.
course-promises: Understand the cultural impact of cinema
Develop critical thinking skills for film interpretation
course-motivations: Gain a deeper appreciation for cinema.
Build analytical and interpretive skills.
Explore film as an art form and cultural product.

title: UX Design Fundamentals
description-brief: Gain a solid understanding of UX design and learn how to create user-friendly digital experiences.
course-promises: Understand the fundamentals of UX design
Learn how to create wireframes and prototypes
Improve usability and accessibility in designs
course-motivations: UX design is essential in web and app development.
Improve the user experience of digital products.
High demand for UX designers in the tech industry.
